expect: 1-2 concrete friction fixes in swarm fundamentals
actual: 2 friction fixes applied: (1) orient.py stale compaction checkpoint suppression, (2) conflict FRONTIER resolved-but-active layout fix
diff: Both expected fixes delivered. orient.py checkpoint noise was a known irritant for 5+ sessions (S359→S365). Conflict FRONTIER mismatch was causing persistent maintenance NOTICE.

fixes.issue: COMPACTION RESUME DETECTED fires for stale checkpoints — all listed uncommitted files already committed
fixes.root_cause: orient.py checks for precompact-checkpoint-*.json existence but not whether listed files are still actually uncommitted
fixes.fix: Added git status staleness check: if <20% of checkpoint files are still uncommitted, suppress the warning
fixes.evidence: precompact-checkpoint-aafda598.json: 1/20 files still uncommitted (5%), all others committed or archived in S363 tool consolidation
fixes.impact: Eliminates false COMPACTION RESUME signal every session since S360

fixes.issue: Active header says 0 but 3 resolved F-CON entries still under ## Active section, causing maintenance NOTICE every session
fixes.root_cause: Frontier entries not moved out of Active section when resolved — detailed evidence kept inline
fixes.fix: Moved resolved entries to compact Evidence Archive section; Active section now explicitly empty; key artifact/lesson references preserved
fixes.impact: Clears persistent maintenance NOTICE for conflict domain

meta_swarm_reflection: orient.py stale checkpoint issue persisted for 5 sessions because no session prioritized the fundamental-setup-reswarm periodic. The periodic itself fires at cadence 5 but was 10 overdue — cadence may need enforcement (like EAD) or higher priority scoring. Target: tools/dispatch_optimizer.py could weight overdue periodics higher.
next: Monitor orient.py checkpoint behavior — verify no false suppression
Run fundamental-setup-reswarm at S370 (5 session cadence)
